intro: Manihot zehntneri, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are rich in starch. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has alternate, simple, and ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is cultivated for its starchy roots, which are used as a food source in various regions.
